img.alt: FAMILY TOOLKIT - Explore the Toolkit Our Family Toolkit is full of resources and helpful information for folks of all ages. As we continue to navigate these uncertain times, this Toolkit will grow so that we can provide families and individuals with the tools necessary to be well socially and emotionally.

p.br: Our Family Toolkit is full of resources and helpful information for folks of all ages. As we continue to navigate these uncertain times, this Toolkit will grow so that we can provide families and individuals with the tools necessary to be well socially and emotionally.

div.p: March 26, 2020: Family Resource Center is continuing clinical services through telehealth - telephone and video conferencing - in place of face-to-face services. Read more about our telehealth services here.
In an effort to keep our communities safe and healthy, we have created this web-page to provide links to the most locally-focused resources for each of the three county areas we serve.

Hancock Helps is being updated daily with Hancock County resources for food, mental health/addiction recovery resources, and information about medical services, church updates, restaurant/store closings, etc.
Findlay’s FOCUS Recovery & Wellness Community is doing daily recovery check-ins on their Facebook page.
The Mental Health and Recovery Services Board of Allen, Auglaize, and Hardin Counties is keeping current information about all AAH-area recovery services.
Allen County Public Health has Allen County’s most current information & updates.
Tri-County Board of Recovery & Mental Health Services created a Google Drive folder with facts & supports.
Shelby County United Way is staying active on their Facebook page to provide Sidney/Shelby County-specific resources.
SafeHaven is a mental health support center with locations in Miami, Darke, & Shelby counties.

Concerned about paying for your utilities at this time?
Read about the resources available from the State of Ohio for utilities assistance here.

p.em: This page was last updated April 1, 2020 at 4:39 p.m.

div.p:
Crisis Hotlines
Allen, Auglaize & Hardin Counties: 1.800.567.4673
Hancock County: 1.888.936.7116
Shelby County: 1.800.351.7347
